item.title: [New Article] Learning Markovian Dynamics with Spectral Maps
item.description: Learning Markovian Dynamics with Spectral Maps J. Rydzewski, T. Gökdemir Learning Markovian Dynamics with Spectral Maps J. Chem. Phys. 160, 091102 (2024) doi:10.1063/5.0189241 / arXiv:2311.16411 / Zenodo:10678142 / plumID:24.005 Abstract The long-time behavior of many complex molecular systems can often be described by Markovian dynamics in a slow subspace spanned by a few reaction coordinates referred to as collective variables (CVs). However, determining CVs poses a fundamental challenge in chemical physics.

Dr. Jakub Rydzewski email: jr@fizyka.umk.pl (0x9C1099DF) wire: @jkrd x: @JakubRydzewski orcid: 0000-0003-4325-4177 arXiv: 0000-0003-4325-4177 scholar: dEMXOpcAAAAJ github: @jakryd Scientific Career 2023-2024 Japan Society for the Promotion of Science (JSPS) Fellow at the National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology (AIST), Japan, the group of Prof. Tetsuya Morishita. Since 2019 Assistant Professor at the Institute of Physics NCU (Toruń, Poland). 2019 Visiting Professor at the Department of Physics, University of Tsukuba, Japan, the group of Prof.

Thesis: Biochemical characterization of phosphatases from Vipera Xanthina venom

Publications 2024 J. Rydzewski, T. Gökdemir Learning Markovian Dynamics with Spectral Maps J. Chem. Phys. 160, 091102 (2024) doi:10.1063/5.0189241 / arXiv:2311.16411 / Zenodo:10678142 / plumID:24.005 T. Gökdemir, J. Rydzewski Spectral Maps for Learning Reduced Representations of Molecular Systems CCP2023 - 34th IUPAP Conference on Computational Physics arXiv:2311.03641 2023 J. Rydzewski, M. Chen, O. Valsson Manifold Learning in Atomistic Simulations: A Conceptual Review Mach. Learn.: Sci. Technol. 4, 031001 (2023) doi:10.1088/2632-2153/ace81a / arXiv:2303.

Software PLUMED – an open-source, community-developed library that provides methods for enhanced sampling, free energy estimation, and analysis of molecular dynamics (MD) simulations. Modules for PLUMED2: lowlearner maze lowlearner (version beta) [1,2] / zenodo lowlearner is a code for learning collective variables (CVs) from standard and enhanced sampling simulations. Installation script and examples can be found in the Zenodo dataset. It is implemented as a module for PLUMED2, an engine for free energy calculations of atomistic systems and enhanced sampling.
